## Step 1 ‚Äî Load your data

```python
import pandas as pd
df = pd.DataFrame({
    "hours_online": [2,4,6,8,10],
    "trust_gov":    [5,6,7,8,9]
})
df.head()
```

## Step 2 ‚Äî Fit a simple model

```python
import statsmodels.formula.api as smf
model = smf.ols("trust_gov ~ hours_online", data=df).fit()
model.summary()
```

## Step 3 ‚Äî Tables (aim for 2+ for full marks)

```python
import pandas as pd
pd.DataFrame({"coef": model.params, "pval": model.pvalues})
```

## Step 4 ‚Äî Figures (aim for 2+ for full marks)

```python
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np

x_vals = np.linspace(df["hours_online"].min(), df["hours_online"].max(), 100)
y_pred = model.predict(pd.DataFrame({"hours_online": x_vals}))

plt.scatter(df["hours_online"], df["trust_gov"])
plt.plot(x_vals, y_pred, color="red")
plt.show()
```
